metadata.title: CVE-2022-0646 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw use after free in the Linux kernel Management Component TransportProtocol (MCTP) subsystem was found in the way user triggerscancel_work_sync after the unregister_netdev during removing device. Alocal user could use this flaw to crash the system or escalate theirprivileges on the system. It is actual from Linux Kernel 5.17-rc1 (whenmctp-serial.c introduced) till 5.17-rc5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
